intro: Eriocaulon carpentariae, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
